  title: "Course Schedule and Readings"

  While the topics covered are broad, each week will feature different examples from genetics, ecology, molecular, and evolutionary biology highlighting uses of each individual set of techniques.    
  
    
      
### Week 1.  
__Lecture:__ [Why Advanced Data Analysis?](lectures/01_intro.html), [GLM Review](lectures/02_generalized_linear_models.html)\
__Etherpad:__ https://etherpad.wikimedia.org/p/609-intro  
__Reading:__ [O'Hara 2009](http://byrneslab.net/classes/biol609/readings/O'Hara_2009_glmm.pdf) through section on GLMs, [O'Hara and Kotze 2010](http://byrneslab.net/classes/biol609/readings/o'hara_and_kotze_do_not_log_transform.pdf), [Wharton and Hui 2011](http://byrneslab.net/classes/biol609/readings/Wharton_Hui_2011_Ecology.pdf), [ver Hoef and Boveng 2007 on overdispersion](http://byrneslab.net/classes/biol609/readings/Ver_Hoef_and_Boveng_qp_neg binomial.pdf), [Hartig DHARMa vignette](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/DHARMa/vignettes/DHARMa.html)
